The IRO coordinates bilateral research and academic programmes of the centres/departments of Dev Sanskriti Vishwavidyalaya with overseas Institutions/Universities through Memorandum of Understanding (MoU).
The centre facilitates Exchange of Students/Faculty members with foreign universities.

The Centre also conducts foreign language courses such as German, French and Japanese for students, researchers and faculty members to help to gain much proficiency in the language for higher studies or job opportunities in the respective countries. The Centre organizes special lectures and seminars by professors/experts from various foreign Universities/Institutions. These talks are very much essential to take up the innovations, research development, to modify or eliminate the existing old technologies. Guidelines to higher education with funding facilities in different countries are also given through these talks. The centre invites prominent visitors from various foreign Universities/Institutions to DSVV to discuss future collaboration. The international collaboration activities are made through these visits to discuss the collaboration possibilities of strengthening the bilateral academic and research cooperation. The centre does the pre-counselling work for admission of students under Foreign Nationals (FN), Non-Resident Indians (NRI), People of Indian Origin (PIO) and Children of Indian Workers in Gulf Countries (CIWGC) categories to Undergraduate and Postgraduate programs.

International Relations Office is focused to share the spiritual and cultural essence of Dev Sanskriti University to all the global aspirants. The IRO focuses to present the model of an existing educational institute which facilitates the holistic development of a human being imbibing the virtues of humanity along with the world class education.
To provide a perfect ambience for our International students to receive the contemporary education with the experience of spiritual transformation.
To establish new relations in the form of Memorandum of Understandings with various global Institutions and to strengthen the existing ties.
To create International Partnerships for various educational, and cultural exchange opportunities.

There is need for an educational institution
which could mould its students into noble and enlightened human beings: selfless, warm-hearted, compassionate and kind.

Graduation Marksheet:Graduation Marksheet (if applying for master’s Program).
Extra- curricular Certificates: NSS, NCC, Scout & Guide, BSGP or any other Sports Certificate.
Caste Certificate: Caste Certificate (if applicable other than general)

Photo Identification Document:Any One of the list: 1. Voter ID
2. Aadhaar Card
3.

Passport Size Photgraph: Passport Photograpgh Specifications –                                   1. Size of photo: 2 x 2 inch, 35 x 45 mm or 35 x 35 mm (5 x 5 cm, 3.5 x 4.5 cm, 3.5 x 3.5 cm).2. Color of background: white or off-white (preferably).
3. Candidate has to look towards the camera. Tilted head is not allowed.
4. Profile or three quarter photo is not allowed.
5. Recency: Taken in the last 6 months.
6. Smile: No smile. Only neutral expression.
7. Eyes: Open and looking directly at camera.
8. Glasses: Only prescription glasses are permitted.
9. File size: 10KB to 300KB.


10. Attire, clothing,


dress code: Casual or professional preferred.
11. Beard: Optional.
Additional Required Documents: Any other documents specified by the institution, such as portfolio samples for art programs or language proficiency test scores for international students.

All Interviews will be conducted offline.
The University holds the right to cancel the application form of a candidate at any stage without any prior notice to the candidate.
If the number of candidates appearing in a center is less than 25, then examination in that center may be cancelled.
DSVV, Haridwar is the only examination center for B.Ed. and Certificates Entrance Examination.
1. B. Ed. applicants are eligible to apply for one additional program by filling a separate application form and paying the form fee.
2. Application Form Fees is Non- Refundable.
Program Selection: Choose the program or major you are applying for from the list provided.
Personal Information: Provide accurate personal details including your full name, date of birth, contact information, and mailing address.
Educational Background: Enter information about your educational history, including schools attended, degrees earned, and dates of attendance.
Supporting Documents: Upload any required supporting documents such as NSS, NCC, Scout& Guide, BSGP and Any other Sports Document. /li>
Review and Submit: Carefully review all entered information before submitting the application. Once submitted, you may not be able to make changes.
Payment: There is an application fee, proceed to the payment section and complete the payment process.
Confirmation: After submitting the application, you will receive a confirmation email with further instructions regarding the admission process timeline and next steps.
Center & Program Change: You can change center and program once you submit the form and form fees by paying Rs. 200/- for each
Application Form Fees is Non Refundable.

March 18, 2024
Application opens

june 30, 2024
Written Entrance Examination


July 05, 2024
Declaration of Written Entrance Examination


July 08-09, 2024
Interviews: Graduation Courses(Present on any one day)


July 10-11, 2024
Interviews: Post graduation & Diploma Courses(Present on any one day)


July 12, 2024

July 13-17, 2024
offline Admission Process


July 18-20, 2024
Admission Process of Selected Candidates from Waiting List


July 22, 2024
Gyan Deeksha


July 23-25, 2024
Deadline for accepting admissions offer


July 26, 2024
Start of Academic Session for New Batch

High School Marksheet: 10th Class Marksheet
Senior Secondary Marksheet: 12th Class Marksheet.
Graduation Marksheet:Graduation Marksheet (if applying for master’s Program).
Extra- curricular Certificates: NSS, NCC, Scout & Guide, BSGP or any other Sports Certificate.
Caste Certificate: Caste Certificate (if applicable other than general)
Photo Identification Document:Any One of the list: 1. Voter ID
2. Aadhaar Card
3.
Passport Size Photgraph: Passport Photograpgh Specifications –                                   1. Size of photo: 2 x 2 inch, 35 x 45 mm or 35 x 35 mm (5 x 5 cm, 3.5 x 4.5 cm, 3.5 x 3.5 cm).2. Color of background: white or off-white (preferably).
3. Candidate has to look towards the camera. Tilted head is not allowed.
4. Profile or three quarter photo is not allowed.
5. Recency: Taken in the last 6 months.
6. Smile: No smile. Only neutral expression.
7. Eyes: Open and looking directly at camera.
8. Glasses: Only prescription glasses are permitted.
9. File size: 10KB to 300KB.


10. Attire, clothing,


dress code: Casual or professional preferred.
11. Beard: Optional.

Additional Required Documents: Any other documents specified by the institution, such as portfolio samples for art programs or language proficiency test scores for international students.

Step 1: Fill the Application Form
Complete the online application form with your personal and academic information.


Step 2: Submission of the Form
Submit any required documents and other information needed.


Step 3:Application under Review
Your application will be reviewed by the admissions committee.


Step 4: Written Test
The written test will be conducted at the declared date at the exam center allotted in case of offline or online to the applicant which will be mentioned in your admit card.


Step 5: Interview
The interview round will be conducted at Dev Sanskriti Vishwavidyalaya, Haridwar for candidates who are selected in the written entrance examination. Applicants are required to bring all their documents for verification in original.


Step 6: Documents Verification and submission Process
Submission of the required documents along with the maintenance fee of the first semester. The payment of maintenance fee can be made through Online mode by the link provided on the university website.


Note: 
1. B. Ed. applicants are eligible to apply for one additional program by filling a separate application form and paying the form fee.
2. Application Form Fees is Non- Refundable. 



                             



 
Application Form Instructions
Follow these instructions carefully to complete the application form:

Program Selection: Choose the program or major you are applying for from the list provided.
Personal Information: Provide accurate personal details including your full name, date of birth, contact information, and mailing address.
Educational Background: Enter information about your educational history, including schools attended, degrees earned, and dates of attendance.
Supporting Documents: Upload any required supporting documents such as NSS, NCC, Scout& Guide, BSGP and Any other Sports Document. /li>
Review and Submit: Carefully review all entered information before submitting the application. Once submitted, you may not be able to make changes.
Payment: There is an application fee, proceed to the payment section and complete the payment process.
Confirmation: After submitting the application, you will receive a confirmation email with further instructions regarding the admission process timeline and next steps.
Center & Program Change: You can change center and program once you submit the form and form fees by paying Rs. 200/- for each

                         



 Admissions Closed for the Session 2024-25.Application Form Fees is Non Refundable.
